Keywords: Metropolis , Politician , Red Son , Scientist
Real Name: Alexander Luthor
Special Powers
ME VERY PLEASED TO MEET YOU: When this click is first revealed, after resolutions generate a Bizarro bystander that has Immune until your next turn, even if this power is lost.
A BOX WITHIN A BOX WITHIN AN INFINITE NUMBER OF BOXES: When this click is first revealed, after resolutions generate a Green Light bystander that has Immune until your next turn, even if this power is lost.
SEND MINIONS TO STOP SUPERMAN: STOP. Mastermind. // When a bystander generated by Lex Luthor is KO'd, after resolutions deal him 1 unavoidable damage.
WHY DON'T YOU JUST PUT THE WHOLE WORLD IN A BOTTLE, SUPERMAN?: Outwit. When this click is first revealed, choose an opposing character. For the rest of the game, that character can't attack Lex Luthor unless they are the only character on their force. Protected: Outwit, Pulse Wave.

Comments
May 4, 2021
Organous
This is partially an English language problem. "Can use" is equivalent to "possess" now, if that helps (there once was a difference). If a character can't use a power, it's as though the power doesn't exist. The "even if this power is lost" clause is in reference to the Immune, in case Lex is hit off that click within that window, so the character would keep Immune.
May 4, 2021
efiscrow
Outwit says that the target can't use the standard or special power. The token generation powers appear not to be a 'use' effect - but rather stating that when the click is revealed generate the token. The power also states 'even if this power is lost'. That feel like it's a grey area that needs Wizkids to rule on - can these be Outwitted? Do these still trigger regardless?
April 28, 2021
Organous
Yes, you've paid 50 points for Outwit, which is normally a problem for how easily such pieces will die without backup. This guy brings his own backup. This Lex will confidently walk into conflict and dare the opponent to attack him. They know what happens when they do, so they won't hit him. Which means you now have a very [b]durable[/b] Outwit piece which needs no protection. You can rely on that Outwit throughout the game. At least, that's the logic it [b]should[/b] have. His token generation does not have Protected: Outwit, so they can just make sure he doesn't get his backup. At least this means they're [b]not[/b] using Outwit on more dangerous things, but yeah, this weakness seems to kind of nullify the reasoning behind using him. He still needs to be hit 4 times before dying, though. That definitely counts for something.

Putting him in the front or basing is definitely a good way to up your chances, but it's certainly not a guarantee. The EE strategy mentioned by Phoenix is definitely a good strategy though that I hadn't thought of, so thanks Phoenix! Great advice! (Not being sarcastic.)

April 4, 2021
Redrover454
Love the idea for this Lex, but considering you can't push anymore, those stop clicks could be a challenge to pull off. It'd be easier if they made him more of a threat on his top dial, but unfortunately, if your opponent just doesn't attack him (which is fairly likely, especially with visible dials) you paid 50pts for outwit. Maybe counter that by pairing him with a hard to KO, high point character to make them desperate for the victory points, like Old Man Phoenix or Omega. Either way, a really interesting, thematic piece with the potential to be pretty fun.
